snippet: The struggling junior partner in Germany’s coalition government with Chancellor Angela Merkel’s Christian Democrats held a party congress that offered an election plan intended to attract voters.
abstract: Free Democratic Party, junior partner in Germany’s coalition government with Chancellor Angela Merkel’s Christian Democrats, holds party congress in Nuremberg promoting election plan intended to attract voters; center-right group, whose declining popularity is threatening to push Merkel's bloc out of power, is seeking strong showing in order to ensure she remains in office.
lead_paragraph: The struggling junior partner in Germany’s coalition government with Chancellor Angela Merkel’s Christian Democrats held a party congress that offered an election plan intended to attract voters.

headline.seo: Germany’s Free Democrats Gather to Lift Flagging Image
headline.main: Merkel’s Flagging Coalition Partner Tries to Bolster Its Image
headline.print_headline: Merkel’s Flagging Coalition Partner Tries to Bolster Its Image
